title: Hunted Toff and Stanley Johnson sacrifice safety for crab sandwiches
text:
How many Hunted contestants find themselves on a yacht? (Picture: Channel 4)

Stanley Johnson and Georgia Toffolo had multiple lucky escapes on Sunday night’s episode of Celebrity Hunted, after their careless behaviour – and a craving for crab sandwiches – saw them nearly get caught a number of times.

For a show best known for its contestants hitchhiking and slumming it out in the woods, 24-year-old Toff and her 79-year-old companion headed down to Torquay for a life of luxury aboard a boat in the town’s marina.

‘This is the life to which one can easily become accustomed,’ said Stanley, which is a pretty strong statement from the father of the British Prime Minister, but not exactly the kind of thing you expect to hear from a fugitive on the run.

While Toff’s reasoning that finding their boat would be like finding ‘a needle in a haystack’ was pretty sound, the 24-year-old’s sensible enough suggestion of looking for supplies went off the rails after the former Made in Chelsea star developed a craving for crab sandwiches (because of course she did…)

Walking up towards the mainland in search of the boujie food, Toff was informed that their captors had been there only minutes before.

But while Toff panicked at the news, Stanley, who had settled down with wine and bit of light reading, was more bothered by the lack of seafood than being caught, saying: ‘Damn, well we’re going to have to have dry crisps then.’

Not the usual Hunted location (Picture: Channel 4)

Yes, that is a wine glass (Picture: Channel 4)

Honestly, you can’t make it up.

And fans of the show were seriously unimpressed with the pair’s lax attitude to the competition, with one writing: ‘Does Stanley Johnson actually know he’s on the run? Or does he think he’s on a holiday show on channel 5?’

Does Stanley Johnson actually know he's on the run? Or does he think he's on a holiday show on channel 5? #CelebrityHunted — Darren Haywood (@darren_haywood) October 20, 2019

Toff: The Hunters are here

Stanley: Did you get my Crab Sandwich? #CelebrityHunted #SU2C — ☘️ 💖 (@Loves_Pink_Gin) October 20, 2019

‘Bloody hell Stanley Johnson makes Johnny English look good,’ another viewer wrote.

Do these people not watch previous #Hunted series? Don’t use phones and don’t get caught on cameras, especially withdrawing money!! 🤦‍♂️🤦‍♂️ #CelebrityHunted @Hunted_HQ pic.twitter.com/Z7QuhYNfC8 — Steven Kelly (@StevenKelly82) October 20, 2019

If Stanley and "Toff" aren't the first to be caught I'm going to write a letter to the hunters telling them how much they let themselves down #Celebrityhunted pic.twitter.com/dmFC3N2BIW — Julia (@JuliaCHowie) October 20, 2019

However, some definitely saw the funny side to the 79-year-old’s total lack of awareness of the show’s rules with his constant phone and cash point use.

‘Stan casually withdrawing cash at every location and literally leaving a trace everywhere they go is killing me,’ one viewer wrote.

‘Every single day they’ve made a massive trace electronically, yet they are always managing to be that one step ahead,’ said the team boss Ben Owen.

‘If I didn’t catch Stanley Johnson, I would probably retire from this job.’
